org.jcaki
Class Strings

java.lang.Object
  org.jcaki.Strings

public final class Strings
extends java.lang.Object

Helper methods for String operations. Some of the code is copied and slightly modified from Apache commons-lang 2.3

Method Detail

isNullOrEmpty

public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String str)

Checks if a String is empty ("") or null.

 Strings.isEmpty(null)      = true
 Strings.isEmpty("")        = true
 Strings.isEmpty(" ")       = false
 Strings.isEmpty("bob")     = false
 Strings.isEmpty("  bob  ") = false

Parameters:
str - the String to check, may be null
Returns:
true if the String is empty or null

checks if a string has text content other than white space.

Parameters:
s - value to check
Returns:
true if it is not null, or has content other than white space white space

containsNone

public static boolean containsNone(java.lang.String str,
                                   java.lang.String invalidCharsStr)

Checks that the String does not contain certain characters.

A null String will return true. A null invalid character array will return true. An empty String ("") always returns true.

 Strings.containsNone(null, *)       = true
 Strings.containsNone(*, null)       = true
 Strings.containsNone("", *)         = true
 Strings.containsNone("ab", "")      = true
 Strings.containsNone("abab", "xyz") = true
 Strings.containsNone("ab1", "xyz")  = true
 Strings.containsNone("abz", "xyz")  = false

Parameters:
str - the String to check, may be null
invalidCharsStr - string containing invalid chars
Returns:
true if it contains none of the invalid chars, or is null
Since:
2.0

repeat

public static java.lang.String repeat(char c,
                                      int count)
Builds a String by repeating a character a specified number of times.

Author Juan Antonio Ramirez

Parameters:
c - the character to use to compose the String
count - how many times to repeat the character argument
Returns:
a String composed of the c character repeated count times. Empty if count is less then 1

repeat

public static java.lang.String repeat(java.lang.String str,
                                      int count)
Builds a String by repeating a string a specified number of times. Author Juan Antonio Ramirez

Parameters:
str - the string to use to compose the String
count - how many times to repeat the string argument
Returns:
a String composed of the str string repeated count times. null, if str is null. Empty if count is less then 1.

public static java.lang.String reverse(java.lang.String str)
reverses a string.

Parameters:
str - input string.
Returns:
reversed string. null, if str is null

insertFromLeft

public static java.lang.String insertFromLeft(java.lang.String str,
                                              int interval,
                                              java.lang.String stringToInsert)
inserts the stringToInsert with given interval starting from left.

("0123456", 2, "-") returns "01-23-45-6"

Parameters:
str - input string
interval - : interval amount
stringToInsert - : character to insert.
Returns:
the formatted string. null, if str is null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if interval is negative

insertFromRight

public static java.lang.String insertFromRight(java.lang.String str,
                                               int interval,
                                               java.lang.String stringToInsert)
inserts the stringToInsert with given interval starting from right.

("0123456", 2, "-") returns "0-12-34-56"

Parameters:
str - input string
interval - : interval amount
stringToInsert - : character to insert.
Returns:
the formatted string. null, if str is null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if interval is negative

rightPad

public static java.lang.String rightPad(java.lang.String str,
                                        int size)

Right pad a String with spaces (' ').

The String is padded to the size of size.

 StringUtils.rightPad(null, *)   = null
 StringUtils.rightPad("", 3)     = "   "
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 3)  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 5)  = "bat  "
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 1)  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", -1) = "bat"

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
Returns:
right padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

rightPad

public static java.lang.String rightPad(java.lang.String str,
                                        int size,
                                        char padChar)

Right pad a String with a specified character.

The String is padded to the size of size.

 StringUtils.rightPad(null, *, *)     = null
 StringUtils.rightPad("", 3, 'z')     = "zzz"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 3, 'z')  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 5, 'z')  = "batzz"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 1, 'z')  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", -1, 'z') = "bat"

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
padChar - the character to pad with
Returns:
right padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input
Since:
2.0

rightPad

public static java.lang.String rightPad(java.lang.String str,
                                        int size,
                                        java.lang.String padStr)

Right pad a String with a specified String.

The String is padded to the size of size.

 StringUtils.rightPad(null, *, *)      = null
 StringUtils.rightPad("", 3, "z")      = "zzz"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 3, "yz")  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 5, "yz")  = "batyz"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 8, "yz")  = "batyzyzy"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 1, "yz")  = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", -1, "yz") = "bat"
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 5, null)  = "bat  "
 StringUtils.rightPad("bat", 5, "")    = "bat  "

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
padStr - the String to pad with, null or empty treated as single space
Returns:
right padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

leftPad

public static java.lang.String leftPad(java.lang.String str,
                                       int size)

Left pad a String with spaces (' ').

The String is padded to the size of size.

 StringUtils.leftPad(null, *)   = null
 StringUtils.leftPad("", 3)     = "   "
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 3)  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 5)  = "  bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 1)  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", -1) = "bat"

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
Returns:
left padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

leftPad

public static java.lang.String leftPad(java.lang.String str,
                                       int size,
                                       char padChar)

Left pad a String with a specified character.

Pad to a size of size.

 StringUtils.leftPad(null, *, *)     = null
 StringUtils.leftPad("", 3, 'z')     = "zzz"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 3, 'z')  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 5, 'z')  = "zzbat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 1, 'z')  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", -1, 'z') = "bat"

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
padChar - the character to pad with
Returns:
left padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input
Since:
2.0

subStringUntilFirst

public static java.lang.String subStringUntilFirst(java.lang.String str,
                                                   java.lang.String s)
returns the initial part of a string until the first occurance of a given string. ("hello","lo") -> hel ("hello", "zo") -> hello ("hello", "hello") -> "" empty string. ("hello",null)-> hello (null,"hello")-> null (null,null)-> null

Parameters:
str - input string
s - string to search first occurance.
Returns:
the substring

subStringUntilLast

public static java.lang.String subStringUntilLast(java.lang.String str,
                                                  java.lang.String s)
returns the initial part of a string until the last occurance of a given string. ("hellohello","lo") -> hellohel ("hellohello","el") -> helloh ("hellolo", "zo") -> hellolo ("hello", "hello") -> "" empty string. ("hello",null)-> hello (null,"hello")-> null (null,null)-> null

Parameters:
str - input string
s - string to search last occurance.
Returns:
the substring

subStringAfterFirst

public static java.lang.String subStringAfterFirst(java.lang.String str,
                                                   java.lang.String s)
returns the last part of a string after the first occurance of a given string. ("hello","el") -> lo ("hellohello","el") -> lohello ("hello", "zo") -> hello ("hello", "hello") -> "" empty string. ("hello",null)-> hello (null,"hello")-> null (null,null)-> null

Parameters:
str - input string
s - string to search first occurance.
Returns:
the substring

subStringAfterLast

public static java.lang.String subStringAfterLast(java.lang.String str,
                                                  java.lang.String s)
returns the last part of a string after the last occurance of a given string. ("hello","el") -> lo ("hellohello","el") -> lo ("hello", "zo") -> hello ("hello", "hello") -> "" empty string. ("hello",null)-> hello (null,"hello")-> null (null,null)-> null

Parameters:
str - input string
s - string to search first occurance.
Returns:
the substring

leftPad

public static java.lang.String leftPad(java.lang.String str,
                                       int size,
                                       java.lang.String padStr)

Left pad a String with a specified String.

Pad to a size of size.

 StringUtils.leftPad(null, *, *)      = null
 StringUtils.leftPad("", 3, "z")      = "zzz"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 3, "yz")  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 5, "yz")  = "yzbat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 8, "yz")  = "yzyzybat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 1, "yz")  = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", -1, "yz") = "bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 5, null)  = "  bat"
 StringUtils.leftPad("bat", 5, "")    = "  bat"

Parameters:
str - the String to pad out, may be null
size - the size to pad to
padStr - the String to pad with, null or empty treated as single space
Returns:
left padded String or original String if no padding is necessary, null if null String input

whiteSpacesToSingleSpace

public static java.lang.String whiteSpacesToSingleSpace(java.lang.String str)
Converts all white spaces to single space. Also eliminates multiple spaces, " a aaa \t \n a\taa " -> " a aaa a aa "

Parameters:
str - input string.
Returns:
all white spaces are converted to space character and multiple space chars reduced to single space. returns null if str is null

eliminateWhiteSpaces

public static java.lang.String eliminateWhiteSpaces(java.lang.String str)
Eliminates all white spaces.

Parameters:
str - input string.
Returns:
returns the string after all white spaces are stripped. null, if str is null

                                                java.util.Collection<?> coll)

concatWithString

public static java.lang.String concatWithString(java.lang.String str,
                                                java.lang.Object... objects)

separateGrams

public static java.lang.String[] separateGrams(java.lang.String word,
                                               int gramSize)
Generates 'gram' Strings from a given String. Such as, for ("hello",2) it returns ["he","el","ll","lo"] for ("hello",3) it returns ["hel","ell","llo"]

Parameters:
word - input String
gramSize - size of the gram.
Returns:
the gams as an array. if the gram size is larger than the word itself, it retuns an empty array. gram size cannot be smaller than 1
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if gram size is smaller than 1
